Ark 2020:

After a while tried the game again. At first all was ok, we had a nice base at Ragnarok. Things changed a lot when more people joined. Some people took the game that serious that freedom of expression was a issue, also to who you talked and what you said. That is not the games fault. The game itself improved a lot since my last review.

For me it was mind blowing to see how serious people take this game. Some are long term unemployed, and they rolled straight from their bed behind the pc to play. That while using weed the whole day, I saw some case of a real paranoid person that used weed because he otherwise got some mental issues he told me. Ok, don't we have medical care for such cases? He was that paranoid that he first didn't trust our allies who provided us access to servers etc. Then he had another mind blow in which he thought I wanted to dominate him. I talked to a allied tribe leader because of a raid we did, and the guy was convinced I made secretly agreements or whatever. After that he started lying and threatened to show everybody a chat I had with him. Since I wasn't lying I gave the chat myself. Creepy. I think the medication weed didn't help a lot against being paranoid. Another guy was besides ark and drugs mainly under influence of his testosterone. 

No room left for family, sports, social contacts in real life, nothing. Horrible. The game seems for some people to be a way of life to escape from real life and they toke it damn serious. For some people it's a real addiction. Some have a few more, like drug usage even hard drugs. Values are not important, the game is. To such people I can only say, look where it brought you. Addicted to a game and drugs, no perspective to get out. Sitting from early morning till late night in a game with other people that can't handle real life won't improve your life.

Is it all like that in ark? No, there are also people with common sense, and they understand it's just a game. They have a real life, values and are nice to be with. The best guy I met was a Russian Tribe leader. He was very social guy, intelligent and a good leader. Also, a young guy who is in his tribe was a very pleasant person. If you play ark with this kind of people the game can be really fun. Since everything changed a lot it's much easier to achieve your goals. So the game can be great, just play it with people that meet your requirements. For me that's definitely not drug users, alcoholics and other lowlifers. 

Edit: after the rather disappointing expierence I talked to a game friend about it. About how serious it was, about not allowed to speak, about whoremongers and  drugs addicts.   We laughed so much. You really met the cream of society, she said very dry, what caused even more laughing 😂😂. 

We decided to go together to a 25x server, since we both like pvp, but dont like to wait forever before we can have some action.  Will be continued with that expierence. 





2018:

This game seemed to be good when it just started. You could build your own base tame some dinos and have fun. Although the dino taming time was way to long, it was kinda fun. I started on a pvp server and had the luck to be in good relationship with the alpha tribe. I could join their raids and was protected. Things changed over and over, first came the breeding, what is a very time consuming boring business and after that they even added imprinting from the bred dinos. That costs a lot of time also, and if you want to boost your dino babies to the max, you need to be there to imprint at certain times. Overall it looks like the developers building this game for either people without jobs, for young people who finished school and have months to go befor their next study starts or people with almost no obligations. 

The real game changer was the server travel. Huge tribes, often Chinese, are able to enter the servers and just work around the clock to wipe every structure and dino. They make life streams and people can fund them if they watch the streams. It's for people who play the game and have a job and other obligations impossible to stop them. They just wait till your offline and if you login again you are lucky if your base is still standing. 

Overall atm I can not recommend this game to anybody, at least not to play on an official server. I didn't even mention the massive amount of bugs, glitches and bad fps because the game is totally not optimized. Meanwhile, they rapidly introduce new structures, new tier, new dinos. That makes the game even more unbalanced as it was before. Small tribes can't deal with that massive time consuming game play, and always have to depend on the big tribes who are able to craft tek tier etc. 

Of cource I could go to a pve server where no pvp exists, but that's not really my thing. So I decided to stop playing this game at least at official servers and maybe completely. It's just to time consuming and if you lose al that time by getting raided by some Chinese massive tribe, which earns money to do so, it's futile.

[h1] My Experience Playing ARK [/h1]

I bought this game some time ago with the intent of finishing the Island map. I never did end up playing it until recently. Everything was going great probably the most fun I've had playing a game, so much so that I bought a DLC pack because after the island I wanted to continue on with the game. Although once I started getting further into the game, I noticed that there are a lot of bugs, I thought nothing of it until I continued playing the game for another week or so where I encountered a bunch of issues. While doing a cave I died and my body and dino went straight under the ground, it took a long time to get my dino back by trying to whistle through the ground, and I had to install a mod to get my body back. It's wild to think that bugs like that are in the game for years with nothing being done to fix them. At this point I was having a little less fun in the game from poor optimisation getting to me, but I really wanted to finish the game, so I continued. Sudden lag spikes got me killed a few more times in the caves but I continued to play besides the fact that something happened during my time of playing and I was getting lag spikes every couple of seconds, I did not change anything to my pc or ark, this just happened one day, and it went on for days. I was ready to fight the three guardians, but at this point I was having to grind hours a day to make saddles for my dinosaurs just so I didn't have to spend hours breeding them again. It went well, and I was going to the tek cave next, but with all the time spent grinding on this game, I found myself forcing myself to play the game because I wanted to beat it, not because I was having fun, at which point, I don't think I was. I didn't care how close I was, I needed a break from the game. Once I came back months later to find the lag spikes were gone, nice. But the tek cave and overseer did take a lot of time to beat as I was unaware of certain things that caused me to restart a lot of my progress in the game. And then, it was over, I had a successful attempt at the overseer and once that was over I was ready to move on to Scorched Earth. Then on download of my character it got deleted. 280-300 hours gone. 

Note that this was my own experience playing the game and other people might not of had any of these issues or people might of had more, if you think you'll have a great time playing the game, go ahead, but there are things you got to watch out for.

[b] Pros [/b]

Really fun game if you just want to mess around with friends
Cool and interesting story

[b] Cons [/b]

Optimisation could be a lot better
Countless bugs in the game, some are game breaking, and some have been in for years
A LOT of grinding
For a new player it will take a long time just understanding what to do and where to start

[h1] TLDR [/h1]

Here's a game I thought I would never get into. I had originally purchased this game on here years ago when I had a more low-end PC and the game was still in fairly early access. It ran like crap, had no tutorial, and I was all but lost. So I had it refunded and moved on, thinking I would never return. 

Well, here I am in 2020 with 165+ hours at the time of writing this, and another 25 hours or so from the "other" launcher that gave away this game for free. I've had a blast with this game over the past few months of getting it again, and I'm glad I gave it another shot. It's honestly the most fun I've had in a game recently, especially with friends. There is so, so much more to do in this game than I originally thought. 

At first, it's going to be difficult. You're going to die a lot. In fact, you will probably die on your way to retrieving your stuff that you dropped when you died, and you'll never see your stuff again. But it really doesn't matter, because once you get better gear, tame some dinos, and make a bigger and better base, you'll scoff at how you ever died to a Dilophosaur or to dehydration. It's a pretty big learning process, figuring out which dinos are hostile, which ones drop certain materials, how to learn and craft new things, so on and so forth. But I feel like that's what got me hooked, because I didn't want to just give up and never see what the game really has to offer.

Once you finally get some good gear and tames, that's where the game really picks up. You have crazy caves to explore, bosses to prepare for and fight, and cool stuff to craft that makes life a lot easier. That is not to say, however, that you won't be doing some grinding. I've always played with friends where we turned up the harvest rate by a couple times, so I can't imagine the solo grind. But it's manageable, especially when you can get tames that help with gathering those materials.

Even at my hours, which is nothing compared to most, I have a LOT left to do, taking into account the free expansions. I haven't even beat every boss on the original island map yet. The only thing I can't comment on are public servers, but I have zero desire to do so. I can't imagine grinding for hours only to lose it to someone with an army of Gigas or Rexes. But when you team up with a group of friends on a private server, it makes it a lot more fun in my opinion. 

This game is not perfect, however. The main meme of this game is that the developers seem to only work on expansions instead of fixing bugs, and I would say that's more or less accurate. To be fair, it's not really the buggy mess a lot of people make it out to be. But it certainly isn't bug free, and unfortunately you'll just need to expect to run into some stupid things from time to time. You also need a fairly good PC to run this, as it's definitely not the best optimized game.

Overall though, if you have a good PC and you're willing to deal with any bugs/glitches you'll encounter, as well as working through a fair bit of grinding, I definitely recommend giving ARK a try, especially if you have friends that play as well. I'm not so sure I would recommend it if you're playing on a laptop without friends but...hopefully that doesn't apply to you.

Out of 10, I would give ARK: Survival Evolved a good 6.5/10 (only buy this during a sale). The concept is one of enthrall, however it is the execution that ruins it. Let me reiterate; if you are planning to buy this game, then be prepared to be frustrated. A very unpolished game. Expect, crashes, bugs, errors and a stupendous amount of minutes or even hours wasted. The game is held with rubber bands. Another point of contention I have, is regarding the gameplay itself. In order to enjoy this game fully, you need to put so much time in. A lot of grinding. Although this pain can be lessened by increasing tweaking the settings when making a game or you can join a more casual server.  In spite of all these issues, I found to have so much fun playing this game. I would find myself trying to go the next step by getting new dinos that can get more resources, or just planning out a new place to build my base. Those are the greatest parts of ARK. The real creativity you can have to build a giant stone base, for example. At the same time this is ruined by the amount of time you have to spend getting the stone, and the annoying bugs and lagging (sometimes crashing) you have to face while trying to do this task. Overall, this game (on paper) is an amazing game. However it is the crap coating it that ruins it. You really have to stick your hand in the crap, in order to reach the greatest parts of this game. If you buy this game, Good luck.

Amazing content, Janky Play as a result of terrible collisions, poor pathing and a stupid quantity of bugs/glitches (such as falling through the world or crashing).

You or the tames that took you hours to obtain, can get stuck in other entities like your own creatures, or even the enemy, trapping you in scenarios that you could have easily avoided, and consequently loosing you many hours of progress. On your adventures across the vast maps, you loose your tames behind rocks and various ledges in the terrain, most of the time not realising until it is too late because you assumed that they were just following.

these issues, are not something I expect to see with this price tag. I cannot recommend this to anyone at full price, in it's current state.

Online official server PVE: 

- some dinos like kaprosuchus or argentavis (more many others) for example are not allowed in these servers to use pick up ability that can be very handy for taming other dinos or taming in the cave (like taming megalosaurus)
- food spoils drastically fast (to avoid that craft cryos to froze your tamed dinos)
- you play by ark admins rules
- but a good place to play on
- very slow taming + slow gowing
- ultimate laggs

Online official server PVP:

- dinos that can pick up are allowed to do so
- players can kill you
- you play by ark admins rules
- very slow taming + slow gowing
- lags

Singleplayer:

- All are allowed (all pick up skills)
- you can be a admin your self to fasten something
- do not see other players (world vs you)
- carnivores aggro more after you lol
- no lags
- can use creative mode

Maps:

Island-  a good place to start (if too populated by players then there are some lags)
Ragnarok- a big world, but laggish (lags make your taming and other things a shore- even your good pet may day because of this)
Valguero- (not so laggish than Island), and is even more player-friendly beautiful map
Not yet been to other maps!

I spent a days on end playing the various maps and DLCs Ark offers (on xbox). I love the concept and content the game has, but after playing a great deal I have come to the conclusion that its all just too broken and not worth the trouble to experience. There have been multiple instances in my playthroughs where my experience has been completely ruined by the bugs. I die to an enemy because the projectiles won't register, I crash randomly and die to aggressive creatures because of it, my inventory cache glitches into the ground so I lose everything, or my structures and dinosaurs don't load properly and look terrible. But that's not the worst of it. On one occasion the game has crashed resulting in me losing my Giganotosaurus (one of the most powerful tames in the game) to a therizinosaurus because I wasn't there to defend it. I spent literal days gathering the necessary equipment to acquire the giga, only for it to be killed because of the game crashing.In another instance, some structures didn't load in while I was flying to my base, resulting in my flyer (flying mount) that took multiple hours to tame getting suck in the map forever. But the worst instance of the game breaking would be where the majority of my items and tames literally just decided to delete themselves out of nowhere. Making all my progress worth nothing.

Also I think basically the only way to play this game and it be worthwhile is single-player or making your own server, because I think the PVP and PVE modes are unplayable. In PvP, I spent a couple hours or so building, gathering materials and then logging off in a tiny thatch house in the middle of nowhere. No joke, I literally logged back on 5 minutes later because I forgot something and everything of mine had been raided. Naturally I tried again multiple times, but the same pattern would occur every time where I would log off and get wiped. Even when I was online, most of the resources and areas were monopolized by other tribes, making it so I could barely go anywhere or do anything. Fighting other plays is fun and all, but more often than not the players destroying your stuff just wait for you to go offline, making it unfun and impossible to progress at all. 
After not enjoying PvP, I began to play on a couple seperate PvE servers, one of which I was able to tame the Titanosaurus and hatched Ice Wyvern triplets. Only for literally every server to just eventually go offline forever without warning, deleting all progress my buds and I made. 
All this prompted my friends and I to start our own server to try and actually enjoy the game. But starting the server itself took like a week. To host your own server you have to either have another xbox with ark or another pc with ark or pay someone else to host it for you. My friend offfered to download ark on his other computer, but the download took OVER 7 HOURS. To add insult to injury the download didn't even work after the 7 hr+ wait. So then I tried to download it. It took the same amount of time and glitched at the very end AGAIN. We eventually successfully downloaded the game and started our own private server, but after a while our dinosaurs and items randomly DELETED THEMSELVES AGAIN. We tried to create a server two other times, but the same thing happened.

Also, the development behind the game is sub standard. One of the most recent events "Summer Bash" just added a few summer themed skins. Despite the small amount of content added, the update broke the whole game and you couldn't go five minutes without crashing. Wildcard spent multiple days trying to fix their mistake and put out multiple updates, some of which just took of space and didn't fix the problem. Also, it should be noted that this isn't just an isolated incident. This pattern of updating the game, breaking it, and having to update the game to fix it has been a staple of the past.

I appreciate whoever has read the entirety of this review. Overall, I love the concept Ark has of surviving on a giant space station with fantastical creatures, but the cons outweigh the pros. I wasted a great deal of time on this game and I suggest people considering playing Ark don't repeat the same mistake.

Thanks for reading.

It's about time I made a review for this game. Only took 2200 hours. This review is base on a mainly singleplayer experience, with some multiplayer at around 2100 hours I'd say. If you ignore the countless bugs and glitches mixed with semi-regular crashes, this game is a godsend. Probably the best survival game ever made, for me at least. The visuals are very good, the soundtrack is pretty good as well. The fact that you don't rely mainly on yourself, but on creatures is what makes this game so good. There are over 100 creatures you can discover and most of them are tamable. There are dinosaurs, mythical creatures, and other things that I don't even understand. So many of them are pretty interesting and cool. But there is one major issue, those countless bugs, glitches, and somewhat frequent crashes are there. It isn't rare for my friend to constantly fall through the floor and die. It isn't super rare that I fall through the floor either, in which I use commands to bring myself back up onto the map because that shouldn't happen. In the genesis magmasaur cave, the map would't load and so I couldn't get a basic layout of the cave because part of it won't load, making me unable to tell if something is a wall or not. I travel to different maps quite often, to get all of the cool creatures the dlcs have to offer, and in multiplayer, I get to a beacon or something that allows me to access my items that I wanted to bring over, and then the game crashes sometimes, leaving my items in a bag that disappears once you leave the game. See how this could be an issue? I can't get my items back because the bag disappears because the game crashed, making my items in that bag disappear (this could be due to a mod conflicting with the game, but I'm to lazy to check which mod it would be.). This game is chore to play without mods, because some things in the game are just totally awful or broken so you need a mod to make them balanced or viable. This game runs very poorly as well. I would say I have a pretty good computer, but this game needs a NASA computer to run without many frame drops. I get constant frame drops on this game. Sometimes something will die, leaving its body stretched  out or deformed, or even just floating in the air sometimes. These can drop your frames a ton. I had to spend over 15 minutes searching for a certain sheep body that was stretched out across out our base because it died in our ovis farm. Some "updates" break the game more than it fixes it. It is such a shame that a game this good has to be this broken. I wanna say that the developers did something that made the game broken, but I'm not sure. Anyway, I would not say that the game in its current state is worth the amount of money they are charging for it.

A little overdue in reviewing this one. At 220+ hours clocked this is an obvious recommendation for the game. 
Simply put the game is as addictive as it is beautiful. Playing multiplayer PvE is a vastly enjoyable experience on a private server, but I do see lots of room for griefing on public servers. Single player, while fun and challenging, lacks the shared experience of accomplishments and wonder that multiplayer has brought. I haven’t delved into PvP but as a lot time gamer I can get a gist of exactly how exhilarating, painful, and rewarding it could be.
I could sing the game’s praises, but honestly I can sum it up with “Jurassic Park meets pokemon meets survival horror meets Avatar landscapes”. My only gripe is being so incredibly vast in scope there are indeed plenty of bugs. All in all livable for the quality of content the game brings.

One of the best games I´ve ever played
Even though you need a better computer to play, i did manage to get it running 60 fps on my crappy notebook.

Pros +
+ Good to play with friends (If you have any)

+ Build your own epic looking bases

+ Tame Dinos and Ride em!

+ Interesting background story

+ Dino Breeding

+ Challenging /// you seem to need some new resources, but its all the way on the other side of the island. That means you either fly there once in a while or you make a secondary base there.

Cons -
 
- Bad AI /// the problem with this is that the dino AI is simple. just run towards you and when there are trees or rocks high enough they´ll get stuck and then its easy for the player.

update: AI has been improved and while it does still get stuck behing natural resources and structures, it can run around hills and slopes

             /// another problem with this is that when you have a dino. Lets take for an example that you have a flyer, you need to land to replenish stamina. You get off your flyer beacuse you need water or something. Something attacks, something that you´re not able to handle. So if your flyer is on neutral, he´ll attack. Most likely result: you´re badly hurt and your flyer dead. If passive: when you come back, you can find your flyer dead.

update: AI commands has been improved a bit, there are a lot of shortcuts you can customize for quick commanding.

- Connection is managable but could be better, Official Server connection isn't great either. /// I have a good connection, its just that the servers can get very laggy.

update: Connection seems to be a more common problem, the devs aren't doing much about it either.

- When you die, you die. /// Even though this is the players problem, if you make mistakes, they can be fatal. "maybe I could visit this cave now" or "Im sure I´ll outrun that". And it's these mistakes that can cost you: all of your items, your favourite dino and sometimes even sanity.

- FOR HOW MUCH??? /// even though i bought this game for 20E, the prices now are way higher, game for 60E and the season pass for 40E. So if you want to buy this game, wait for holidays or something. wait... is it snowing? :O

update: as I'm editing this, christmas is right around the corner once again.

BEGINNER SOLO LOCAL SERVER REVIEW:

Just starting on a local server, single player mode, but I'm enjoying this BIG FLIPPING open world survival game.  As all games, this one has good things and bad things.  I've specified a few good and bad below based on what stood out to me.  I'll update this review as i roll along through the game.

The Good:  
-LOCAL SERVER allows you to set your own parameters.  For example, when you chop down a tree, you can get 5 wood or 40 wood.  there are a LARGE range of settings to adjust.  this is EXTREMELY helpful to a new solo player. 
-Open world maps are HUGE and look good.  PVE open world play is fun and engaging. 
-Dinos are fun to tame and train.   Dinos are helpful for defense, carrying resources and attack.  Dinos also provide meaningful buffs, such as the tiny slow diono that provides XP buffs when you pet it.  The player can RIDE many dinos.  This is a strong area.
-COOL TEK DINOS to tame, ride and breed.  Cool is a factor, of course. 
-Crafting is VERY DEEP and provides meaningful tools.  BUILDING is very fun and also DEEP.  This is a VERY strong area. 
-SKILL TREES are somewhat basic but gives the player LARGE buffs in basic categories, like damage, speed, health, stamina. 
-FAST travel system between bases, although you CANNOT take any inventory or gear with you when you fast travel, which is very strange. 

The Bad:
-Save system SUCKS.  you can't manually save at all, and when you die, you loose all your gear and inventory items ( to be fair, you can go to where you died within a couple of hours and pick up your gear, but dying with no save is still annoying ).  A good manual/quick save state system that preserves your inventory and gear would VASTLY improve this game. 
-MAP is a DISASTER.  NO MINI MAP and the player map is small, awkward and hard to read. In a game based on open world play, this is very strange and a big problem. 
-DENSITY OF PREDATORS in the brush is WAY too HIGH.  If you get away from the starting areas you'll often be attacked multiple times traveling a couple hundred yards.  In 5 minutes you can have 5 different types of creatures trying to eat your face, often in packs.  This breaks any sense of realism and can be very annoying.  The brush is dangerous, but not every ten feet. 
-NO TUTORIALS.   You're dumped in the game and good luck.  Get used to hitting up google and Utube. 
-Movement skills are limited and awkward.  No climbing, mantling, grappling, let alone wall running or zip lining. vertical movement is very limited.  A good grappling system would improve this game a lot. 

The Summary: 
Despite several weak areas noted above, I'm enjoying this game and will continue playing solo/local server.  I will NOT play on any public server as many players on those servers are jerks. 

One GREAT thing about this game; you drop into this game and you play 100% of the time, unlike many modern AAA games where 1/2 of your game time is taken up by self indulgent cut scenes and NPC chitchat. No need to skip cut scenes in this game.   why? there are no cut scenes.  YAY !!

You will NEVER be able to play this game without running into multiple game breaking glitches that wipe away all of your progress after hours and hours. This game is poorly developed, poorly optimized, and will leave you feeling ripped off and disappointed every time you try to play. Its been out for years yet has all he flaws and more of an early access. The developers, instead of utilizing time to sniff out the flaws, spend their time creating content to soak more money out of the fan base. Some of the issues present in September 2020 that you would never expect from a AAA title or professional game studio: The game crashes constantly (only game that does this on my over-spec PC), gamepad support is terrible and incomplete (you need to use a mouse in the inventory and you need to use a keyboard to switch your character from first person to third person), There are weird designs with character movement (One instance is when you are swimming fast in the water, your character jumps right when he gets to shore, stopping your progress and letting whatever you may have been running away from catch up to you and create damage), Some weird enviromental designs (When it rains, if you go into a structure it stops raining even outside. You can look outside and see it stops raining and if you go back and forth it will start and stop raining outside. This is by design. I would love there to be rain on the roof while you wait the storm out inside), There are weird spawning glitches (After spending hours getting set to fly into the caverns for an egg, I finally made my way into the caverns and after searching everywhere for an egg and dying one after another, I quickly realized there were NONE. I checked online to find out there was a notorious egg spawn glitch where no eggs spawn. SO I wasted all that time for absolutely nothing and lost those resources and tames. I had enough of it after that and quit playing. This was last spring. I mean come on, I spent so much time gathering those tames only to lose them and other resources including my time grinding for absolutely nothing, all due to a glitch that made it impossible to be rewarded. The servers suck. You need to stay far away from official or you have to suffer the poor balancing and the inevitble rubber banding where the dinosaurs slide away from you and back towards you and stop registering your attacks. Even in unofficial the servers go offline for maintenance multiple times per day for 20-60 minute stretches or more so you get kicked and have to play another game or do something else which is exactly what you want from a game (time restrictions). You'll run into bugs variously when you try to do things all the way down to not being able to run for some reason. Its literally one thing after the next. I got sick of googling solutions when I realized I was spending an equal time suffering from issues as I was enjoying the game. This development studio is TERRIBLE. The menus on this game are visually unappealing and confusing. Some of the sliders don't even work and you cant find explanations anywhere for instance one of the Player Stats Per Level Sllders called Temp Fortitude literally does nothing and has no explanation anywhere. But; the concept is cool and when it works it a loaddd of fun to be in an open world survival crafting game with dinosaurs. Oh and the STORY is TRASH. Its like pulling teeth to run into a moment that is scripted and when you do its low production and literally the one cutscene is if you beat the game lol all lackluster.

This game reminds me about those old movie games you'd play as a kid, having the most fun on Earth in a game with pretty bad reviews. ARK  is hard to call a "good" or "polished" game for quite a number of valid reasons, but in the end, who cares? It really brings out that nostalgic joy of just playing a video game, and simply having fun.

I write this review now, as I wait, being stuck between some rocks...  Probably about 30 minutes until I starve to death...

Ark has a wonderful concept.  Amazing graphics.  And could be an entirely immersive experience.

It is a grand concept with a failed execution.

Some will say, "IT'S EARLY ACCESS!!".  I do not care.  They sold DLC, they are not early access.

"BUT THEY GOT SUED!!!"

Yes.  They did.  They are not early access.

While the general gameplay could be a grand ol' time, the game is riddled with bugs that have been present for years.  Corpses diseappearing under rocks and the ground.  Engine based ((No, not lag based, actual issues with the engine processing pathing.))  rubberbanding issues.  A Laissez-faire approach to player griefing (No, not Minecraft's perversion.  The real MMO definition of "No reason for the action but to make someone else's experience miserable") griefing.  And just flat bugs...  Like getting stuck inside of a dino you are fighting and being unable to move...  This game is a pathetic attempt at a shell game.  They provide content, while making little effort to actually make sure the content there to begin with is worthwhile. I cannot fathom where their sense of logic comes from, and cannot assume there is, or will be one.  Do not, pay for this game.  In the end all you'll see is a perversion of what could have been a good idea....  Wasted.

**UPDATE**  Yes.  The game still sucks like a two dollar whore.  12th time I lost my belongings due to my corpse glitching.  The time consumed building resources, then having to rebuild this many times?  If our courts had any intelligence left in them they'd allow me to sue for my time they've wasted with their garbage coding.

**UPDATE**  Two hundred hours in now.  The game is even worse than it was before.  The only real points to it are trying to capture dinos (Forget keeping them alive.  Between the pathing rubberbanding, broken AI, broken bounding/hit boxes, and blizzard of other bugs, prepare to lose the dino you spent RL hours upon hours taming to be worth nothing more than a near coronary rage inducing experience.  Unless you just never use them..  What fun?), try to build (If you have the patience for the broken snap points, and having anything less than metal smashed just for someone else's giggles.), and steal other people's stuff.  Once you've explored the island, options for entertainment are limited.  Imagine HALO with a bigger map and better, but buggier landscape, where you have to spend days building up to get decent weapons and 10 hours to get a jeep.

**UPDATE**  Should have mentioned before.  If you have any history of epilepsy anywhere in your family ever, you should not ever touch this game.  The snap point system for building sucks with black hole style force.  The flinging and rapid flashing back and forth of the temporary shadows as you try to place things in futility....  Well, I'm not epileptic and it gives me a headache, so it would flat out murder you.

**UPDATE**  Still haven't fixed the timeout problem during downloading or updating mods, which shows their priotities.  They love taking content, they do not wish it easier to deliver.  Common sentiment for a company who's only out for money.

**UPDATE**  This game has been out how long, and they still can't get the building system to detect what is and isn't obstructed right?  How many years has it been?  Oh, right, they don't give a fuck.  Nevermind, continuing to view this game as a total waste of a good concept.

Like any other person that hasn't bought this game, I knew it was shit for a long, long time and made by a shitty company and developers (I realize devs are rarely the culprit, but the game's code is still horseshit), but I still bought it to play with a person I once knew.
Playing the game was a pain and done out of spite, to keep it short.

Price should be about $8, that should cover the overall quality of experience you may get from it. Not the ridiculous $60 price tag IN ADDITION to the DLCs for 3x shittier optimization than Ubisoft's and EA's AAA games.

Shitty optimization, shittiest UI and UX I've seen unironically, and ridiculous character designs that are completely out of place to the rest of the game, even if you try to make it non-ridiculous.
The fact that it is running at 50% render resolution by default should tell you something about how shitty of a job has been done coding this game.

Concept of the game is alright; the execution--not so much.

This will be my first Steam review though I have played quite a bit of games on Steam. 

ARK is an awesome game with the Devs relentlessly adding more content on almost a weekly basis. By content I really just mean adding new dino's. But that is still awesome and refreshing. These types of games are best played in a community. WIth that being said, if you do not make friends (get into a good tribe) and play on a daily basis the PVP and/or HARDCORE servers are certainly not for you. It will be nice if the Developers add a new map or at least add on to the current map. Making the current map larger would be awesome. This game requires skill, diligence, perserverance, a certainly positive attitude. 

Despite the fact that I have moved on until the full game is released I give this game a 9/10. 

I am 100% certain that the final product will be a 10/10

I can not get enough of this game! I know there are a lot of bugs and issues that may need to continue to be addressed but they don't deter me from playing unless an update breaks it. When I first saw the game back when it was in early access/alpha/beta, I watched [u]Etho[/u] and the guys play. I actually thought it was a really cool looking [u]Minecraft[/u] mod because it let you mine and build but with the Pokemon aspect in the form of dinosaurs and ancient mythical creatures. I fell in love immediately. I have over a thousand hours in this game and I am only just now trying to actually beat the story. I recommend this to anyone looking for a [u]Pokemon/Minecraft[/u]-like looking for challenges and large explore-able terrain. There are plenty of mods to tailor the game to one's liking. Best played in single-player unless you have trusted friends on a decent server. Take it for what it is and not what the community wants it to be and it's really not that bad.

I finally gave the game a 2nd chance while playing with my sister on my dedicated server (using a server manager). The game is so incredibly unbalanced for a 2 person coop play style that I spent several hours fiddling with the settings in an attempt to get it closer and closer to balanced only to discover that it becomes even more unbalanced later as you play. Everything, from harvesting to dinosaurs to player stats, all of it felt very unbalanced. I was able to get it somewhat balanced for the early stages of the game, but as soon as we needed obsidian to progress further into the game to get better armor, we realised just how much more unbalanced the game really is.

The game was not fun at all for either of us. There was a lot of frustration building up with every minute spent into the game. I doubt I'll ever give it a third chance.

Now I'd like to preface this review with the fact that I've never played this game competitively against others, which I assume is also a major part of the game I haven't gotten into personally yet. 

Anyways, in my eyes ARK: Survival Evolved is an extremely entertaining game that you can easily find yourself sinking many hours into without realizing it. This, for me, is because of its challenge, large areas to explore, new creatures to discover and tame, landscapes to make into your home, and many other neat aspects which I find balanced fairly well in ARK. Of course there are still things which I don't like and to me are quite annoying.

My favourite among the fun side of things has to be the way that the challenges evolve throughout the game. For example in the beginning of the game, survival alone is difficult, but as you progressively build up your home, outgrow your home, and build new homes to house your new pets, you find that those early challenges disappear and are replaced with getting stronger creatures and battling the bosses of the map. Close second is adventuring through caves and the ocean, its exciting and in the case of the ocean quite spooky sometimes with gigantic overhangs and underwater cliffs, and then massive creatures lurking below and around you. Third would certainly have to be discovering creatures and their special little abilities, the variation in the creatures gives you many options for the same utility with different pros and cons 

Of course no game is without fault, and to me that comes in the way the game deals with progression of levels, alternative sources of resources, the dreaded grind, and building issues, though there are more. To start with level progression, it seems to me that in the start of the game you have resources for things at level 30 but are at level 10, and that when you are at level 80 you're starting to use stuff from level 60! I might be an odd one out in that complaint. The way the game deals with alternative sources of resources is without a doubt wrong, it gives you these many sorts of tools like fishing rods, and late game resources being substituted by drops from more common creatures (looking at you polymer and cementing paste), but most of the time one method of collecting the resources is vastly better, why use a fishing rod when you can jump in and hand stab a fish instead for example. People in the reviews constantly complain about the grinding of resources, which is true for a solo player, especially on the default settings, but I personally just think the most annoying part is having to transport all these materials too and from your main base, regardless of where you set up you have to transport lots of SOME heavy resource, traveling back and forth for hours, but I don't mind it that much in the end. My biggest gripe about the game which might seem very very trivial to those playing competitively or who simply dont mind, I absolutely despise the building mechanics, it's near impossible to build nice looking structures that are well lit enough to see everywhere and functional enough to bother with making it look nice anyways. 

One who is more observant would see that my "cons" paragraph is significantly larger than my "pros" paragraph. I think this is in part due to the nature of people being more keen of what they don't like than what they do like. I would also like to add that even the annoying parts of the game give you those "Ah ha!" moments when you figure out a solution to one of them. I would recommend ARK to anyone from the guy who does nothing but play videogames all day to the people who use their computer an hour a day, its easy to play for hours on end, but satisfying to have small little five minute achievements as well.

Ark has the biggest love hate relationship in my steam library, but i still think it's fucking amazing.

A lot like Rust but with dinosaurs.
You start off naked and primitive but slowly upgrade through the ages of technology as you level all the way up to guns and radios and gpses. 

Fun by yourself but way more fun with a group of friends. 

Three things, however:

1. The griefing on public servers is way overboard. You'll join a game with nothing and have max leveled griefers with machine guns spawn killing you or locking you in a prison cell on repeat. Highly suggest making your own server to avoid this.

2. The game has an incredibly insane scaling for the taming speed of dinosaurs. No joke, some of the higher dinosaurs can take upwards of 8+ hours to tame. HIGHLY suggest turning "taming speed" up to 3 times the max on your server to avoid this because that's stupid 

3. The game has so many little nuances to it that it never teaches you, but really that's any sandbox game. If you REALLY want to get into this game, the wiki is your best friend.

All of that aside, highly recommend. get some friends together and make a tribe and see what you can find!

I would definitely recommend this game. It is a very tough, primitive survival game that really requires patience. Whether you choose to play PvE or PvP, it's honestly all about finding the right server for you. Unless you're a veteran at this game or just like to play solo, this game really requires teamwork for a PvP experience. I believe there is some sort of storyline and boss battles to do, however I have not completed any of these since I prefer to play PvP.

The game definitely has it's share of bugs but what game doesn't? The ARK team is very good at responding to game issues. 

I have recommended this game to other friends and they have loved it.

'ARK' is a poorly optimised game and unless you have a top-end insanely good computer, like I’m talking NASA standard you will not be able to play this game on its highest settings. This game really disappointed me as 'ARK' has the potential to be a very good game, but the developers let it down, if the game was better optimized, making private servers were easier, this game probably could be one of my most played games, but instead I think I’ve played it twice.

As a survival game it is pretty fun. However, it definitely not worth paying retail price of nearly £50 as there are better survival games out there that are cheaper, for example; The Forest, RUST and The Long Night. I get why people enjoy the game, who doesn’t want a game where your only objective is to tame wild Dinosaurs? It just sucks that the game wasn’t made by some big company that could have given it the time and development it deserved.

I bought ARK when it was on sale for £10 and even at this price, I don't think the game was worth it. I can’t justify recommending this game, but, if you insist on buying it highly recommend you wait until it is on sale.

On September 17, 2020, when you entered the game, you were banned window appeared. I've been playing ARC for over 10,000 hours and I don't understand the reason why I was banned.
Nobody told me the reason or warned me that I was breaking something in the game.
I started to build a base on the map Island in the cave where the artifact of the heavenly lord, and my friends told me that all the tribe buildings in this cave were wiped out. Perhaps this is the reason for the ban.
But several tribes on the Island map also built their bases in the caves with artifacts.
These are Tribe Kingdom and Evombled.
I play honestly and have repeatedly asked the developers to unlock my account and give me the ability to play the game that I bought all the add-ons with my own money.
But I received no answer from them.
Therefore, I am considering the possibility of going to court to get my money back, to compensate for moral and material damage (my pressure rose sharply, I went to the doctors on the day I was banned).

Alot of bugs in this game, even some soulcrushing ones that would have you losing hours and hours of work in an instant with no support in sight. Game can be difficult as a new player starting on official servers trying not to be crushed by higher level tribes. Research for an unofficial server host with well structured rules and active player base. Whether hardcore pvp or just taming dodos, finding a server that caters to the experience you are looking for is key in not wasting hours and hours of your time. The game is a huge installation. If you have all maps + mods installed you could be looking at close to a 200gb install. Game is poorly optimized, you need a decent rig to fully appreciate this game. Some days will be good and some bad. There is tons to do and explore even at 6k hours I still figure out new methods of farming or building techniques. You can easily play for hours and hours. Modded servers add alot to the vanilla experience. Highly recommend playing on a modded server. If you like grindy sandbox games or to build extravagant structures you'll totally be into ARK. Having all DLCs and season passes is worth it in my opinion especially if they run some kinda special discounted price on the game.

TLDR - Runs like a paraplegic, glhf with your 2080ti i9 rigs. Hundreds of hours of content to enjoy with friends... Play non-dedicated, set tether distance to 100, up the tame speed and xp rate otherwise you'll literally spend 6hrs staring at your monitor watching a dino's tame bar slowly go up and be on edge trying to protect it and yourself from predators. It sucks. 

It's a fine line between pleasure and pain with this game. 950hrs in still haven't done everything there is to do. Modability is insane, played 650hrs of semi-vanilla, then discovered the Pugnacia and Primal Fear overhaul mods annnnd BAM another 200hrs of pleasure and pain. 

This game will make your 2080ti i9 rigs soil themselves, optimisation who? That's fine I didn't want more than 40fps in a game that looks worse than Halo 3 from 2007 anyway. 

Multiplayer is enjoyable BUT WHY IS TETHER DISTANCE A THING. Why am I forced to run a dedicated server of which I need to port forward and spend hours setting up with mods just so my friends can be free from virtual chains that prevent them from getting too far away from me. 

The official servers are filled with tryhards, and progress is stupidly slow... Play a non-dedicated with your friends, tweak the server settings, chuck on some convenience mods and you'll have a blast. 

Now in terms of DLC, Aberration is the ONLY one worth buying. The rest are whack and the free maps are so much funner anyway especially with a mod overhaul like Pugnacia or Primal Fear. 

10/10 Would foolishly buy all Ark's content again in hope Studio Wildcard uses their profit to idk maybe OPTIMISE THE GAME. IT'S BEEN 5 YEARS. NO ONE WANTS GENESIS PT 2.

Do you wish that Jurassic Park would make sweet sweet love to Minecraft and then push a baby out through a crazy graphics canal? That's more or less what you're getting with Ark - a fun sandbox game in which you can build structures and boats, tame and fight dinosaurs, explore massive maps, and unlock boss fights. There are plenty of expansions that make the already huge world even bigger, and it's easy to sink hours (and hours...and hours) into this game, even with altered settings for high resource yields and fast tames. I would definitely recommend playing on a private server or single player, though, because the public servers are hot stinking garbage. I would also recommend a few mods like Structures+, which make building easier and more fun.

Edited 09/24/2020 With 1,700 hrs in, Im still loving this game. It is not for everyone, but thought I would shed some light on the two years since my last update on this review. They have released new maps, which if great, but still horrible lag. Seriously, sometimes my character rubberbands yards from the lag. You find yourself always typing // in chat to see when lag is over and then continue what you were doing. My lag can range from 5 sec up to about 40 sec. This game is not optimized at all. I have gigabit speeds. Up and Down, I get around 950mbs. They seriously need better host. Nitrado (who is the company use) is just horrible. Once people start breeding dinos, and building their base, the lag comes. Seriously, When I log into the game, sometimes it takes about 40 sec before my base completely spawns in. My rig has a 10900k 32gb of 3200 ram, with a 2080 ti, and I still only get about 45 - 57 fps. Im only running at 1440p also. 4K drops me to about 32 fps. If you have friends to play with, i suggest creating a private server. You'll have a blast, but avoid official servers till you know what your doing. Also, still wait for sale. When you get dinos who die, or lose things because of the lag, at least you got a good deal on a sale. 


Edited 6/17/18: (WAIT AND BUY THIS DURING A SALE)
With almost 700 hrs in this version alone, and about the same amount if not more on PS4 version, this is an amazing game. Most of the bugs have been ironed out, but there is still a few issues with lag when playing on official servers, but I truely believe that those issues are from the official servers hosted by Nitrado. They are European based, and think they seriously milk and limit their bandwith. 

Some of my greatest and most memorible moments are on Ark, but if your starting off, or this is your first time playing, I would seriously suggest jumping on a unofficial server or creating your own with Ark Server Manager. It gets rid of the horrible grind in the game, and makes it fun to play and explore. They have put a bit of story into the game now, but you get it with all the notes you find in the game, and when you beat the game. Still, really no story and very hard to actually beat the game without cheating. As of today, I would reccomend this game, but seriously, wait for a sale. They happen frequently and you can get the entire game with season pass for about $20 - $25. My original review is below. It was before official release, but they were already selling dlc, so to me, that means that the game was out. 

(Original Review) Let me say that having this game on all three platforms, it is definitely not worth $60. The game is a lot of fun, but there are still way too many problems, not just that but there is no story. This is an open world survival game, and that is it. The servers still have tons of problems with rubberbanding, and disconnects. They sometimes feel like they operate on Dial Up. Recently on PC it would take about 15 minutes to finally logon because of server problems. Now when I speak about server problems it’s not that there are too many people online, on one of the servers I was playing on it said there were only 7 people out of 70, but would constantly get errors because the server itself was experiencing problems. This was going on for two weeks, and it always seems to happen during an event that gives double XP. Normally this wouldn’t be too big of a problem but with ARK, the problem is that you get disconnects. 

So let’s imagine this, you’re traveling around with your good gear on a flying mount. All of a sudden you get disconnected for no reason, now you already know that you’re most likely dead from falling from the sky because that’s what happens when flying and you get disconnected. So you go and try to login to get back to your body and retrieve your gear,  but server issues won’t allow it. Your body despawns after 15 minutes so if you cannot get back on immediately and have a second flying mount to get to where your body was, then you might as well kiss all your good items goodbye because they despawn with your body. Or lets say your taming / Breeding a Dino. Some can take 9 hours (IRL) as a baby that needs to be constanly hand fed. Which mean you need to stay online with them just running to get food and manually putting that food into the baby dino to feed them. Then you get disconnected. After 15-30 minutes of trying to log back in, and all ready spending hours raising or taming these dinos, you finally get back on only to find that your tame is no longer around or your baby has starved to death. This has been a constant problem for ARK that the developers will not seem to fix. Even now with those of us who bought early, the developers have openly said that they need to finish working on retail before fixing our problems, which in other words say “we have your money already, will get you when we can“. This might be because of the servers that Ark uses, which are Euopean based. Dont know why they would use a far away server, maybe it was just cheaper, but it is what plauges this game. Now if this game is $60 for its entire content,  then I may have a better review and say it could be worth it, but charging $60 for a game that is broken, and another $60 for the DLC is absolute GREED as other reviewer‘s have stated. If you really want this game, I would wait for another steam sale before picking this up, my friends and I were able to buy it for $15 during the Steam Summer sale so I have no complaints. This review is to warn others who are thinking about buying it.

I tried this game multiple years ago in order to play it with friends. I was extremely disappointed, because I should have loved it. Dinosaurs? Crafting and building systems? Open world? Cool!

Not only could my current computer barely handle playing it on the bare bones potato graphics settings (my computer at the time was fairly nice, could play other multiplayer games just fine), but I found the crafting system clunky with way too many steps. Even if you were with a group, everyone had to unlock new recipes individually. My friends who had already played would be building stone and higher-tech things and I was stuck looking for resources to build thatch buildings because other options weren't available to me, even if I had the materials to make better stuff. I understand that scaling system for tools, like in Minecraft and Terraria - but for everything? 

Due to potato graphics, it was IMPOSSIBLE to stay alive for any length of time to make meaningful progress around my lag. I was a near-sighted caveman going 'is that a predator on the other side of the water or a harmless plant-eater?' Meanwhile my friends and brother kept insisting it was a great game. Oh what beautiful water graphics! Oh look at my tame pterodactyl! Look at my cool house! All while I'm rubbing sticks together and trying not to die and getting increasingly frustrated.

To me, accessibility is a huge issue for multiplayer. If you can't play with your friends and have a good experience, you can't have fun. The optimized game might be gorgeous and expansive and deep, but if only a percentage of people who try it can experience that level of quality, is it really a great game? 

Maybe I could try it again now that it's been out for a few years and on a better computer. Maybe the graphics would be better, I'd have less lag, and I could actually get through the 'tutorial' stages of building stuff and get to the fun part. But my computer at the time matched the recommended specs for this game, and it was zero fun to play. So getting over that initial burn in order to actually give the game another shot and a fresh start isn't going to be easy. If I could, I'd get a refund for the game and never look back.

EDIT: Tried this game again on pve, spawned inside a cave with big base, the only way out was a cave that was blocked with locked gates. uninstalled. not worth it.

THIS PRETENDS TO BE AAA+ GAME WITH AAA+ PRICETAG IS NOT WORTH IT!

As of start of 2020 I tried to get back to the game. The official servers still lag like hell. I see some things have been changed, some things like kibbles and the ability to pick up structures you place are very nice, but the core game still has the same bugs it had years ago. Dino tails are the buggiest thing ever because why not have actual physics push you around. Official servers still struggle with performance even with half the maximum players, I guess cheapest bid wins. Game now costs 50+ euros, to me that would mean AAA+ title but this game is definitely not, having very very basic performance issues and bugs going unadressed for years. I would consider this game worth 30 euros and still wait for sale unless developers actually get off their asses and fix the glaring issues.

To give a little extra background on this 2020 return, I powerplayed on the Valguero map for 3 days, got some help and was doing perfectly fine. Even got wyvern egg with a nice level, but the server lag was the most annoying thing. I was still very enthusiastic and willing to overlook all the little things until I was trying to get another wyvern egg, the game got a huge lag spike and server crashed, then rolled back to where i was flying atop the canyon with wyverns.. ofc it spawned new ones next to me before i could even see anything relogging back, and the game spawns you normally even if it's a rollback from server crash and you were flying a dino. 

Sucks to be you, now you fall!

My body got slaughtered before I even hit the lava by wyverns newly spawned even when they were not there when servers crashed (mind you, this is OFFICIAL PVE SERVERS which are apparently trash). I went back but my stuff was in the lava. This is prime example of how the game will fuck you over with the bugs we reported literally years ago, and the developers just bring new candy to the game but never fix the bugs.

I want to love ARk. I really want to and I do love it when everything is working great. The game is a sandbox with interesting maps, creatures, and gameplay. It is very grindy at times but that also makes it have a great sense of achievement. ARK is also a game of 'force multipliers'. You tame certain dinos you can increase your gathering speed of certain resources by ten-fold! And who does not love dinosaurs! The challenge is greatest at the start and you can really benefit from teamplay.

Now I said it is great when it works. The important thing is that often it does not. Your dinos get stuck, collision detection is garbage and sometimes the giganotosaurus you are trying to raise just simply vanishes into thin air. These are all still manageable in an EA title (that has been for that way for a long time and released a DLC, mind you!). Why I cannot give this title a positive review is that with all the great ideas, the implementation may look nice but when you scratch the surface it breaks. The Scorched Earth DLC they released was marketed with a feature that you can transfer your character between ARKs (the maps in different servers). Now people, including myself, have lost characters to that process. Characters we have literally put hundreds of hours into leveling up, building our bases and taming and breeding  high level dinos. I hope ARK developers take a more professional approach and stop deploying faulty patches and get a grip, this can be a great game.

Ark is a great game but remember that it is in early access when getting involved.

--UPDATE--

I cannot recommend this game anymore. The developers will show you nice screenshots and make lots of updates and tell in patch notes how they fixed and added stuff. In reality, no, they may have added some visual stuff, maybe even some gameplay mechanics. But fixing things is not on their agenda. The game is basically ready as they want it, to show cool screenshots to sell more copies. By the time you realize the game's technical implementation is BAD, to put it in nice terms, they have your money and no, those issues will never be fixed. Instead they will put the money you spent into some new stuff that looks cool but is really only another money grab. The ideas and theme in this game are good, but you cannot play this without a supercomputer and you must live in south korea with a very good (wired) internet connection and must use a private server running on a supercomputer. Official servers are abysimal and the amount of jittering and  connection losses makes you pull out your teeth. This is even multiplied if you have a wireless, have fun losing the dinos you spent hours getting because of bugs with physics or because the server dropped your connection when you were fighting.

Before the performance, especially network-wise, is fixed I advice to stay away unless you have a supercomputer and a very good wired connection.

1. CUSTOMER SERVICE IS unimaginably poor, not just sort of bad, absolutely horrendous. 
2. Wastes hours on taming/breeding/grinding, e-hording experiences.
3. AI needs work
4. PVE Public servers are abominations, PVP is a never ending crap show of changing metas as the nerfs endlessly rain down.
5. Items have different decay timers, so if you build on a public server, you have to regularly check in or your hard work goes poof.
6. Random times things go poof (characters, cryo fridge storage and tames) (see #1).
7. No timeline has EVER been kept, sometimes launches are close, sometimes they are delayed by months.

All in, for a couple of artists, they did ok.  The problem is that they keep making promises and then not keeping them so vote with your money and go to the next game.

Might be a bit surprised by the fact I'm not willing to give a positive review to this game considering the number of hours I've put into it over the last 4-5 years. Unfortunately I would not recommend this as a game for anyone to purchase beyond the base game without paid DLCs (which is almost mandatory if you want to get anywhere fast as the paid DLCs give a massive boost to resource gathering (Abberation = metal, Extinction/Genesis = element).

Without touching upon the player-base/offi server status, my reason for this is that considering just how old this game is it still rife with glitches, exploits, and what seems to be an automated anti-meshing system that will also permaban your account.

The glitches/exploits appear with each new DLC as examples: Meks in Extinction able to bombard bases to the ground from outside of turret range, also revisited with Magmasaurs in the most recent Genesis expansion (Because why not repeat mistakes of the past?). Go see the HowToArk youtube channel for far more examples of how stupidly broken this game can than I could list here. (Incidentally that channel should be sponsored by Wildcard as he does more to get bug/exploits fixed than their own dev team).

The bit regarding anti-meshing is actually what makes me really unwilling to recommend the game though. If you are not already aware meshing involves going under the mesh of the map which enables you to bypass player defenses, go to areas you are not supposed to be able to build etc. An anti-meshing system to prevent this is necessary. 

HOWEVER, Some of the maps are so unfinished they have holes in the mesh that literally allow a player to walk straight through into the mesh zone, these holes actually look like they could be small ratholes to build in legitimately except you die the moment you go into them due to anti-mesh. Well that is cool right? That is how it is supposed to work right? You'll just make sure you don't go back there again lol! Except they've managed to mess this one up also which you quickly realize when your account gets banned for...meshing. 

TL:DR - Could not recommend anyone spending the full cost for this game, or it's DLCs when you are more likely to lose everything to glitches and exploits, before the sucker punch of a permanent auto-ban rocks up because Wildcard are too lazy to finish their map. If you want to give it a try pick up the base game when it is on sale and check out the free player-designed DLCs. Don't waste your money on any more of it.

This game has a lot of good thing going for it. Unfortunately it is all overshadowed by the extremely poor developers, who release game breaking patches on the regular without testing it seems, and "enforcement team", which I guess is a euphemism for the mafia, who takes money irl from players to ban other players from playing the game. They won't ever admit making mistakes if you are caught in one of the game's hundreds of bugged interactions with the environment, which eventually will create false positives for their automated systems to punish or even ban you. I suppose it might be a tactic to get the people who are addicted to keep buying new copies of the game, however that is speculation. Not an unfounded one though.

As a long term member of the community, I've certainly heard dozens upon dozens, if not hundreds, of first account stories concerning these types of experiences. Their system for punishement is among the most outlandish ones I've ever heard of and it seems it is up to the individual member of the enforcement team what they wanna do, which takes away all forms of consistency. Sometimes outright cheating gets no punishment, and sometimes false positives gets unjustly banned without any warnings. And since their environment have straight up holes in it you fall through without meaning to, false positives are a common occurence.

I do not recommend buying this game, unless you plan on paying for your own server where you or a friend are in control. The official servers are a cesspool of toxicity and unpunished cheating/abusing game mechanics. I could delve deeper into the specifics, but after 10.000 hours of playing on official servers, I am convinced this is the way the developers want to keep it.

Felt like i was Ten again. Love learning about dinosaurs when i was young. To see all the variation of dinos running around was awesome! Then survival kicked in running from everything tryin to eat me, to building a base for some protection. I play it solo, im sure its fun with other people but i truly love the feel of being in danger every time i leave the base. Taming up more powerful dinos and crafting armor / weapons just to build up the courage to adventure out a little farther each time is a great first time progression feel.

This game has such potential. It is still laggy, buggy, and could do with some more optimization, but boy does it hit hard. For any kid that loved dinosaurs, this game will capture your heart. This game is what VR gaming was designed for, but sadly the VR experience is virtually nonexistent for ARK as of yet. Hopefully it will be payed attention to in the future.

Game is honestly amazing and filled with sooooo much things you can do with plenty of DLC that introduce new maps, dinos and equipment for you to use and explore 

there are soooo many creatures you can Tame and ride in ark each and every one having something special or unique about them this allows you to tame a creature that suits your needs

this game also has really good official servers that barely ever have any problems they might be a tiny bit laggy and sometimes will crash for a bit but is generally good 

Each map in this game is freaking huge and actually has a lot of cool aspects about them for example you can build on massive Mountains, Cliffsides, Caves or even eventually the Ocean or you can just build on the hills or flat land :P

graphics of this game is also really beautiful and everything in this game has a lot of detail like even the rocks on the ground has plenty of detail best part is that if your stressed out that your PC might not be able to handle the games graphic settles on epic you can just turn them to low and still play easily 

The game also has plenty of equipment from tools you need to climb and scale mountains to simple Metal axes and Picks and even extremely cool armor that can protect you against the elements or against physical attacks and sometimes both. the game also has a big variety of weapons such as crossbows, swords and spears to rifles, shotguns, pistols and even rocket launchers 

the only thing i find to be a problem in this amazing game is the community and the devs :( 
although small percentage of the community is good a majority of it is completely toxic for example if you choose to play on a pvp server you will get a player vs player experience such as being verbally attacked in text chat or even voice chat in game, the bad side of this community will completely wipe your base simply because they want to.. they also tend to abuse the game and exploit such as biting through the mesh or looking through structures / walls into your base On PVE servers its actually better but not by much sometimes in chat you will still be called out or just have some random guy attacking you but generally isn't that bad most of the people on PVE is actually quite chill but they can still be toxic and kill all your dinos and destroy your base by luring dinos to your base to destroy your buildings or use the flying dinos to pick up and drop giant snakes or bears into your base to kill all your tames 

the devs although they are extremely kind and fun to be around (when they are present on a server) and will always try their best to answer and get back to your tickets as fast as possible however they have smacked down a lot of rules on official servers such as no mesh biting (biting through the map such as the floor or cave walls) but the devs simply don't enforce their rules and although they will answer to your reports they generally wont do anything about it 

basically the game is amazing but this is pretty much how it goes

if you play on a PVP server expect to be trolled and completely wiped 

if you play on a PVE server expect to be yelled at in the text chat and have people dropping wild dinos into your base 

Dont expect any help from the devs

Scorched Eath came out and although the amount of added content was amazing the DLC price was annoying, especially since the base game was so far from finished.  And still a lot of  bugs and preformance issues went uncorrected.

The vanilla game became stale and I started playing on modded servers.  The modding community is amazing and there is a huge amount of content to experience, but it is constantly hog tied by the Devs lack attitude towards the modding tools.

Now the price as completely skyrocketed. Even if this was a "finished" game the price would be too high.  This is a $30 game.

Honestly can't recommend paying for this game.
It's definitely not worth the price especially considering the countless bugs that have been in the game for years and the absurd price tag.
The game is a logistical nightmare if you're someone who enjoys creativity games because the snap points for each structural element seem somewhat arbitrary and most of the time just don't line up. It's extremely easy to accidentally destroy hours worth of work because the game bugs out and places a wall in the wrong spot, automatically destroying what was already in its place.
If you get this game for free, then great. I recommend that you give it a try. I just can't recommend to anyone actually paying for this game because at the end of the day, it's just not worth it. The developers are too busy churning out paid DLC to bother improving the stability of the base game.

Original: (From September 2017)

After 800 hours, I'm going to review this game.

It's a "finished" game, for 60 dollars. (I got it for 15 dollars) The only reason it's "Finished" is so they can release DLC without getting backlash for doing so while it's early-access. The game is still horribly buggy, and the optimization is still trash. This is a money grab, and the DLC is going to be a "look, more stuff, come back to our game!" It'll work too, those players out there will buy the DLC, and then come back and play until they get bored of the bugs and optimization. It's a great experience, a great concept, but once you realise the grind and bugs to be had in this game, it'll ruin the whole game. Do NOT buy this game for 60, I'd say *maybe* worth 15 when it's on sale, however I find it even worth less.

Ark is, for me, almost a perfect concept. Fight and tame iconic historical and imaginary creatures and build yourself a homestead. It has a lot of deep and rewarding gameplay that can be tailored to what you enjoy. 

But there's no way I can recommend this to anyone visiting the storefront, not at full price.

Ark seemed to hit a point where it had a huge identity crisis. Things were pushed toward PvP and caused all sorts of balance issues in any public server. PAID DLC came out during the Early Access period and the game STILL is very unoptimised for many people. It's as if this game got to a point where it didn't know if it wanted to be survival, PvP or a teamwork based game and that the development suffered hugely for it. It really is a shame.

The public servers are a mess and I think it is because of this identity crisis, they never were balanced well for a PvP experience and the PvE side suffered. There's a lot of griefing and trolling, which is expected in online games but there's been very little done to counter it on official servers. 

There's also many bugs and halted development on various features, such as procedural Arks, DX12 implimentation, maps and mods that they've officially taken under their wing are not updated for recent builds and many little bugs are just left for many, many months with no communication as to if they are even on their radar for looking at. 

Paying £50 and more for the DLC isn't worth it when the devs seem to push spin offs, new content and let the foundations they were built on, stagnate.

---

HOWEVER...

I HAVE recommended this game to a few people that may play with me. ARK as a game concept is brilliant and it does have a few features that no other game provides currently. It is such a shame the dev team doesn't put more into polishing and finishing up things it takes on. 

The graphics are beautiful (if unoptimised) and the ecosystems, especially on some maps, are really well done and it does make you feel part of it, rather than player 1 tromping round destroying all. 

The settings for the game play are really customisable. If you play with a small group on a private server (I recommend that, public servers are awful) you can make things tailored around it. Playing SP? Not got a lot of time? You can change it to suit. If you prefer the hard survival game feel, you can most certainly ramp it up or if you are more interested in breeding fancy colour creatures and building you can give yourself an easier time with harvest, breeding etc multipliers.

There's a huge depth to the game and although it's really open on what you make your ARK centered around, each element of the sandbox is well done and fairly well balanced. It's worth the investment with a hefty price reduction, but not at full price.

Revision: Steam is now asking me to REVISE my review as I have played an additional 120 hours.
I stand by what I have said. I bought the game, so I may as well play it, but there is no way I will give WIldCard more of my money and no way I would recommend people to do so in the future. 

There are still elements of the game I really enjoy, as I said, it is almost a perfect concept in terms of taming, breeding, exploring and homesteading. But even five years on, there are some very old bugs that were never addressed. In fact the game is still riddled with bugs old and new and systems are still unpolished. The UI is gross and clunky and the neon text was never changed, it looks placeholder. The building is still horrible, especially when you compare it to other survival style games. The game is still badly un-optimised, its huge in size and although the graphics can be pretty, you are going to need a decent set up for them to not look like plasticine. Yet the Devs keep releasing DLCs and go on to copy paste this engine in other games with a slightly different theme. I can't recommend anyone to support this sort of practice.
I can't comment on the multiplayer because i don't play multiplayer enough to justify making a comment. the single player however is extremely fun.
