I have very mixed feelings about this game, first of all, i would never buy this for full price, because you are going to have to pay extra for some of the maps anyways, and 50 bucks is way overpriced for the amount of maps you get. now, about actually getting in the game, and about one of the main problems of the game, the loading screens. i am lucky enough to not usually have too many problems with them, but my friend can literally only play with us about 20% of the time, we do not go a single day without at least one of the 4 people on our server not being able to connect. then, when you get into the game it is usually somewhere between laggy and extremely laggy. another issue i have is when you load in for the first time, theres a cinematic shot of you looking at your arm with epic music playing that would be super cool... if the audio didnt cut out every 3 seconds and completely ruin it. those were some negative things, so here are some positive things too, when you actually get onto the game and everyone can actually load in, this game is extremely fun, i absolutely love this game when it chooses to work, but unless you work at nasa, you will have to deal with lag and connection errors. now, if you are thinking of buying this game, expecially if you have friends to play with, i do recommend it, but, i would say you should only buy this on sale, i would not pay more than like 20 bucks for the base game.

Used to play this masterpiece on console, now I sold my PS4 for a laptop. Eventually I will be getting a beefier laptop in order to play this game flawlessly. But, here is what I have to say: 

The vanilla game itself for newbies isn't extremely welcoming. People who are not into dinosaurs or survival will have a very difficult time becoming invested in this game. Vanilla rates are slow and grindy, so I recommend for newer players to play on a 5x rates (or higher) server or solo server w/ custom rates. This will get rid of the grind time and reward you sooner, but effort is still required to progress in the game. 

Ragnarok is a great starter map in my opinion but so are the rest of the vanilla maps (center, isle). Scorched Earth, Abberation, Extinction, and Genesis are all extremely fun maps with their own niches and metas. I highly do not suggest starting out on any DLC map as a newbie, as these maps are much less forgiving and more complex.

I suggest to play with friends, since its way more fun. And, don't eat narcoberries.

It's quite expensive, yes, and lag is a very real threat, but try to think of any other, well-known, dinosaur craft/survival games? There aren't any. Ark is a very unique and in my opinion well-executed (for the most part) game. The dinosaur variety is great, graphics medium and up are fine, you just have to be aware of a few bugs and the likelihood of lag. Lag is never ideal, and it can ruin everything in Ark, which is probably my main point against it. As long as you have a decent PC and you play on good servers (I would not recommend official servers) you should be alright. Make sure you play with others though, and tribe up. It's much more fun that way.

Ark is a game that you will either love or hate. It has glitches... sometimes on an epic scale, like a thousand raptors over spawning on a map and lagging you out so badly their is no hope for escape. It's punishing at first, you will be thirsting, starving, naked and freezing while everything tries to eat you. When you die, you have to find your body or you lose your stuff. Official servers are cluttered and full of people who only raid you when you are offline and it's hard to run on alot of computers. 

BUT, I think it's one of the most fun, magical feeling open world sandbox style games out there. You can build pretty much whatever you like, tame, breed, ride dinosaurs. It really shines with mods to tweak the game to your individual preferences by adding new dinos, horses, RP decor and more. I love this game.
Somewhat hard to run on low-medium end computers, online multiplayer is incredibly hard to play with friends.

Really fun game, but this is no where near able to be considered out of early access. Constantly getting stuck in spots, and dinos alike along with having trouble moving around at times due to the really wonky fighting and building mechanics. The game feels so weightless, and you feel so disconnected from it, the fighting sucks dick, and all you do is just get pushed around or slammed off a cliff. 

Often feel like im not hitting things when I am, and it feels off at times to move, especially on dinos the movement feels clunky as all hell. And dont even get me started on how much power a high end clan can have. I may not have alot of hours, but I dont see the point of people able to move entire herds of dinos server to server, I can understand people moving, which is nice. But entire herds of base desroying dinos to just wipe a server? Come on, not to mention you can build to block off caves, and obelisks, and there are no restriction whatsoever on where you can build which feels very wrong to me which in all means that a big tribe can bully and take over the entire server. Thank god for the ability to transfter through loot crates otherwise hours of leveling would be gone. 

The AI as well? Oh my god the fucking AI, whoever did the AI for this game needs to be shot in the foot, or at the very least replaced. Its so dreadful, and agonizing to deal with trying to organize and call over your dinos or a pack just glitches into you and your stuck.

TL;DR - Really fun game, has so much potential, and so much to do. But it feels unfinished and very clunky. Along with the ability of server - to - server raid and blocking off resources makes it very irritating to play. They have not, and most likely will not optimize this game, fix the AI, and make all around QOL improvements.

1 Word, GLITCH

The game is fine and all, but it keeps crashing.

This game has a VERY steep learning curve, and you WILL die a lot before you can establish yourself, even on a PvE or private server.

Death is only a limited handicap however, and the only real problem becomes losing your gear.  At low levels that's not such a problem as your gear is very primative and mostly easy to recreate.

Once you get over this, the game is a lot of fun, although often hugely frustrating.  But you get to ride around on dinosaurs with assault rifles, so as a friend put it "it's all my childhood toys come to life".
This game is amazing and its better with mods if you want mods there in the steam workshop search up ARK and enjoy i like this game and recommend it to all that see this thank you have a nice day.

4th negative review for this game. Mostly due to continued lack of response to known issues while pushing to make more money.  Most recent DLC actually REDUCED player count, it just sucked. Downloads take hours or days. Optimization is NONexistent, it is like racing turtles in a toaster during a hurricane (slow, burnt out shell and very confusing for stupid reasons, ie: a 224mb download has taken a full 20 hours on a hybrid instant transfer HD and lightning speed internet). WIldcard constantly pumps out random unlabeled updates with no reason or info, just wait a day while this unknown source material is dumped in to your rig.
